cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: racing west-northwest through the eastern Caribbean, forecast to slow and arc northwest toward Jamaica, eastern-central Cuba, then the southeastern Gulf/Florida peninsula early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola late Saturday, then near Jamaica/Eastern Cuba Sunday–Monday

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands, southern Leeward Islands, southern Dominican Republic & Haiti, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida Peninsula (future)
weather_observation.wind: Very low (<5%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge threat confined to Caribbean and possibly Florida coastline
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible if remnant system tracks inland toward Mid-Atlantic late next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and rip-currents may reach the Virginia Capes toward the middle of next week
